title: The Apprentice team brings in 'record-breaking' £1.2MILLION in sales to win electric bike challenge
text:
Veteran businessman Alan Sugar is a notoriously tough task master on The Apprentice.

But even he was impressed when contestants achieved staggering sales figures in last night's episode.

Lord Sugar, 72, was left speechless when it was revealed one of the teams brought in £1.2million in the electric bike challenge - believed to be the biggest wins in the history of the show.

The jaw-dropping total left viewers at home reeling and the rival team - who had brought in just over £400,000 - speechless.

Lord Sugar, 72, was left speechless when it was revealed Team Empower (pictured) brought in £1.2million in the electric bike challenge - thought to be the biggest win in the show's history

The jaw-dropping total left viewers at home reeling and the rival team- who had brought in just over £400,000 - speechless. Pictured, Team Unison's Riyonn Farsad on hearing the news

Viewers were quick to praise the incredible total - believed to be a record-breaking amount

One fan tweeted: 'Wow. I’m surprised @Lord_Sugar didn’t fall off his chair.'

Another wrote: 'I NEARLY FELL OUT OF MY CHAIR WHEN CLAUDE SAID ONE MILLION HOW THE F***.'

A third added simply: '£1 million?????? Legendary stuff.'

It also meant a second successive triumph for Iasha Masood, who led Team Empower to victory by targeting what she called ‘the Yummy Mummy market’ exemplified by her fantasy client: ‘Sophisticated Sarah.’

The win marked a second successive triumph for Iasha Masood (pictured), who led Team Empower to victory by targeting what she called ‘the Yummy Mummy market’

The Apprentice fans shared their delight with excited tweets after the win, pictured

While the approach was initially mocked by her teammates, it ultimately proved invaluable.

Whether Sophisticated Sarah would really like the bike, let alone buy it, was a moot point.

It was blue for a start (traditionally regarded as a boys colour) and the bike’s name was ‘the Aphrodite’ (which was more feminine but still terrible).

In contrast Team Unison struggled to stick to the brief given by project manager Thomas Skinner (far right) and ultimately brought in just £400,000 in sales

The bikes designed by Team Unison (left) and Team Empower (right) for last night's task

But it was enough to bring in orders totalling £1, 242, 810.

In contrast Team Unison struggled to stick to the brief given by project manager Thomas Skinner and ultimately created a sporty, bright red bike that was deemed completely unsuitable for their desired elderly consumer.

Ultimately it was Lubna Farhan who was fired from the show after she failed to contribute to the task.
description: Lord Sugar, 72, was left speechless when it was revealed Team Empower brought in £1.2million in sales in the electric bike challenge - believed to be the biggest wins in the history of the show.
